member.name: E:Gnostice.Controls.WPF.DocumentViewer.PageCountChanged
member.summary: Occurs when the viewer is processing pages of the document so the page count will be updated progressively.
member.remarks:
Some formats such as PDF require documents to explicitly specify the total number of pages in the document. Some others such as DOCX do not.
Even as the viewer displays the first few pages of a document, it may be (in the background) still constructing the layout of the remaining pages. During this time, the property will represent the last page that has been constructed in the background, not the total number of pages in the document.
When processing documents such as DOCX, handle this event to get notified when the total number of pages is known. Only then, the PageCount property becomes accurate.

member.summary: Search for text in the forward direction starting from either the current cursor position () or the position of the last search occurrence.
member.param: The text string to look for.
The text search mode. Whether literal search or pattern search using regex.
Text search options.
The result of the last search operation or null if the search should start at the current cursor position ().
member.returns: Details of the search text occurrence () or null if no more occurrences of the search text could be found.

member.name: P:Infralution.Licensing.WPF.EvaluationDialog.EvaluationMonitor
member.summary: The evaluation monitor used to determine the trial period

member.name: P:Infralution.Licensing.WPF.EvaluationDialog.ProductName
member.summary: The name of the product being licensed

member.name: P:Infralution.Licensing.WPF.EvaluationDialog.TrialDays
member.summary: The number of days for the evaluation period
member.remarks: After this period has expired the ContinueButton will be enabled after an increasing delay until the limit is reached - at which point the ContinueButton will no longer be enabled.

member.name: P:Infralution.Licensing.WPF.EvaluationDialog.ExtendedTrialDays
member.summary: The number of trial days after which evaluation is no longer enabled
member.remarks: If this is set to a value greater then then users can continue to use the product past the evaluation period - however there is an increasing delay in enabling the ContinueButton. Once the ExtendedTrialDays limit is reached the ContinueButton will no longer be enabled.

member.name: P:Infralution.Licensing.WPF.EvaluationDialog.ExtendedTrialDelay
member.summary: The time to delay enabling the Continue Button for each day once the period is exceeded.

member.name: P:Infralution.Licensing.WPF.EvaluationDialog.EvaluationMessage
member.summary: The message to display to the user

member.name: P:Infralution.Licensing.WPF.EvaluationDialog.AutoSize
member.summary: Should the window be resized to fit the content
member.remarks: This property is provided for compatibility with the Windows Forms version of the dialog. WPF applications can alternatively use the SizeToContent property directly.

member.summary: The result for this dialog
